context: Uber was the dominant ride-hailing platform globally in 2015, valued at $50B+. The company was expanding aggressively worldwide while facing regulatory battles and competition from local players.

competitors.name: Lyft
competitors.notes: Primary US competitor focused on friendlier brand positioning

competitors.name: Didi Chuxing
competitors.notes: Chinese ride-hailing giant, later acquired Uber China

competitors.name: Gett
competitors.notes: Ride-hailing service in Israel and Europe

competitors.name: Traditional Taxis
competitors.notes: Incumbent taxi industry fighting Uber's disruption
